intro: [WRONG START] Achimenses kleei, commonly known as the flame violet, is a tropical perennial plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from red to orange, often with a contrasting central stripe. The plant produces tubular flowers that are typically borne on upright, branching stems. Its foliage consists of heart-shaped, glossy leaves that are dark green in color. Achimenes kleei thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
